00048 typedef unsigned long spl_t;
00049 
00050 #define splhigh(x)  rthal_local_irq_save(x)
00051 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00052 #define splexit(x)  rthal_local_irq_restore((x) & 1)
00053 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00054 #define splexit(x)  rthal_local_irq_restore(x)
00055 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00056 #define splnone()   rthal_sti()
00057 #define spltest()   rthal_local_irq_test()
00058 #define splget(x)   rthal_local_irq_flags(x)
00059 #define splsync(x)  rthal_local_irq_sync(x)

00061 typedef struct {
00062 
00063     volatile unsigned long lock;
00064 #if CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00065     const char *file;
00066     const char *function;
00067     unsigned line;
00068     int cpu;
00069 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00070 } xnlock_t;
00071 
00072 #ifndef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00073 #define XNARCH_LOCK_UNLOCKED (xnlock_t) { 0 }
00074 #else
00075 #define XNARCH_LOCK_UNLOCKED (xnlock_t) {       \
00076         0,                                      \
00077         NULL,                                   \
00078         0,                                      \
00079         -1                                      \
00080         }
00081 #endif /* !CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00082 
00083 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00084 
00085 #ifndef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00086 #define xnlock_get_irqsave(lock,x)  ((x) = __xnlock_get_irqsave(lock))
00087 #else /* !CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00088 #define xnlock_get_irqsave(lock,x) \
00089     ((x) = __xnlock_get_irqsave(lock, __FILE__, __LINE__,__FUNCTION__))
00090 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00091 #define xnlock_clear_irqoff(lock)   xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,1)
00092 #define xnlock_clear_irqon(lock)    xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,0)
00093 
00094 static inline void xnlock_init (xnlock_t *lock) {
00095 
00096     *lock = XNARCH_LOCK_UNLOCKED;
00097 }
00098 
00099 #if CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00100 #define XNARCH_DEBUG_SPIN_LIMIT 3000000
00101 
00102 static inline spl_t
00103 __xnlock_get_irqsave (xnlock_t *lock, const char *file, unsigned line, const char *function)
00104 {
00105     unsigned spin_count = 0;
00106 #else /* !CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00107 static inline spl_t __xnlock_get_irqsave (xnlock_t *lock)
00108 {
00109 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00110     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00111     unsigned long flags;
00112 
00113     rthal_local_irq_save(flags);
00114 
00115     adeos_load_cpuid();
00116 
00117     if (!test_and_set_bit(cpuid,&lock->lock))
00118         {
00119         while (test_and_set_bit(BITS_PER_LONG - 1,&lock->lock))
00120             /* Use an non-locking test in the inner loop, as Linux'es
00121                bit_spin_lock. */
00122             while (test_bit(BITS_PER_LONG - 1,&lock->lock))
00123                 {
00124                 cpu_relax();
00125 
00126 #if CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00127                 if (++spin_count == XNARCH_DEBUG_SPIN_LIMIT)
00128                     {
00129                     adeos_set_printk_sync(adp_current);
00130                     printk(KERN_ERR
00131                            "RTAI: stuck on nucleus lock %p\n"
00132                            "      waiter = %s:%u (%s(), CPU #%d)\n"
00133                            "      owner  = %s:%u (%s(), CPU #%d)\n",
00134                            lock,file,line,function,cpuid,
00135                            lock->file,lock->line,lock->function,lock->cpu);
00136                     show_stack(NULL,NULL);
00137                     for (;;)
00138                         safe_halt();
00139                     }
00140 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00141                 }
00142 
00143 #if CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00144         lock->file = file;
00145         lock->function = function;
00146         lock->line = line;
00147         lock->cpu = cpuid;
00148 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00149         }
00150     else
00151         flags |= 2;
00152 
00153     return flags;
00154 }
00155 
00156 static inline void xnlock_put_irqrestore (xnlock_t *lock, spl_t flags)
00157 
00158 {
00159     if (!(flags & 2))
00160         {
00161         adeos_declare_cpuid;
00162 
00163         rthal_cli();
00164 
00165         adeos_load_cpuid();
00166 
00167         if (test_and_clear_bit(cpuid,&lock->lock))
00168             clear_bit(BITS_PER_LONG - 1,&lock->lock);
00169         }
00170 
00171     rthal_local_irq_restore(flags & 1);
00172 }
00173 
00174 #define XNARCH_PASSTHROUGH_IRQS \
00175 case INVALIDATE_TLB_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR: \
00176 case CALL_FUNCTION_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR: \
00177 case RESCHEDULE_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00178 
00179 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00180 
00181 #define xnlock_init(lock)              do { } while(0)
00182 #define xnlock_get_irqsave(lock,x)     rthal_local_irq_save(x)
00183 #define xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,x)  rthal_local_irq_restore(x)
00184 #define xnlock_clear_irqoff(lock)      rthal_cli()
00185 #define xnlock_clear_irqon(lock)       rthal_sti()
00186 
00187 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */

00191 #define XNARCH_DEFAULT_TICK          1000000 /* ns, i.e. 1ms */
00192 #ifdef CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC
00193 /* When the local APIC is enabled, we do not need to relay the host
00194    tick since 8254 interrupts are already flowing normally to Linux
00195    (i.e. the nucleus does not intercept it, but rather an APIC-based
00196    timer interrupt instead. */
00197 #define XNARCH_HOST_TICK             0
00198 #else /* CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */
00199 #define XNARCH_HOST_TICK             (1000000000UL/HZ)
00200 #endif /* CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */

00249 typedef struct xnarchtcb {      /* Per-thread arch-dependent block */
00250 
00251     /* Kernel mode side */
00252     union i387_union fpuenv __attribute__ ((aligned (16))); /* FPU backup area */
00253     unsigned stacksize;         /* Aligned size of stack (bytes) */
00254     unsigned long *stackbase;   /* Stack space */
00255     unsigned long esp;          /* Saved ESP for kernel-based threads */
00256     unsigned long eip;          /* Saved EIP for kernel-based threads */
00257 
00258     /* User mode side */
00259     struct task_struct *user_task;      /* Shadowed user-space task */
00260     struct task_struct *active_task;    /* Active user-space task */
00261 
00262     unsigned long *espp;        /* Pointer to ESP backup area (&esp or &user->thread.esp) */
00263     unsigned long *eipp;        /* Pointer to EIP backup area (&eip or &user->thread.eip) */
00264     union i387_union *fpup;     /* Pointer to the FPU backup area (&fpuenv or &user->thread.i387.f[x]save */
00265 
00266 } xnarchtcb_t;
00267

00296 static inline long long xnarch_tsc_to_ns (long long ts) {
00297     return xnarch_llimd(ts,1000000000,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ);
00298 }
00299 
00300 static inline long long xnarch_ns_to_tsc (long long ns) {
00301     return xnarch_llimd(ns,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ,1000000000);
00302 }
00303 
00304 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_time (void) {
00305     return xnarch_tsc_to_ns(xnarch_get_cpu_tsc());
00306 }
00307 
00308 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_freq (void) {
00309     return RTHAL_CPU_FREQ;
00310 }

00312 static inline unsigned xnarch_current_cpu (void) {
00313     return adeos_processor_id();
00314 }
00315 
00316 static inline void *xnarch_sysalloc (u_long bytes)
00317 
00318 {
00319     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00320         return vmalloc(bytes);
00321 
00322     return kmalloc(bytes,GFP_KERNEL);
00323 }
00324 
00325 static inline void xnarch_sysfree (void *chunk, u_long bytes)
00326 
00327 {
00328     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00329         vfree(chunk);
00330     else
00331         kfree(chunk);
00332 }

00338 #define xnarch_halt(emsg) \
00339 do { \
00340     adeos_set_printk_sync(adp_current); \
00341     xnarch_logerr("fatal: %s\n",emsg); \
00342     show_stack(NULL,NULL);                      \
00343     for (;;) safe_halt();                       \
00344 } while(0)

00349 static inline int xnarch_setimask (int imask)
00350 
00351 {
00352     spl_t s;
00353     splhigh(s);
00354     splexit(!!imask);
00355     return !!s;
00356 }

00416 
00417 static inline void xnarch_leave_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00418 
00419 {
00420     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00421 
00422     adeos_load_cpuid();
00423 
00424     /* rthal_cpu_realtime is only tested for the current processor,
00425        and always inside a critical section. */
00426     __set_bit(cpuid,&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00427     /* Remember the preempted Linux task pointer. */
00428     rootcb->user_task = rootcb->active_task = rthal_get_current(cpuid);
00429     /* So that xnarch_save_fpu() will operate on the right FPU area. */
00430     rootcb->fpup = &rootcb->user_task->thread.i387;
00431 }
00432 
00433 static inline void xnarch_enter_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb) {
00434     __clear_bit(xnarch_current_cpu(),&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00435 }
00436 
00437 static inline void __switch_threads(xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00438                                     xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb,
00439                                     struct task_struct *outproc,
00440                                     struct task_struct *inproc
00441                                     )
00442 {
00443 #if __GNUC__ < 3 || __GNUC__ == 3 && __GNUC_MINOR__ < 2
00444 
00445     __asm__ __volatile__( \
00446         "pushl %%ecx\n\t" \
00447         "pushl %%edi\n\t" \
00448         "pushl %%ebp\n\t" \
00449         "movl %0,%%ecx\n\t" \
00450         "movl %%esp,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00451         "movl %1,%%ecx\n\t" \
00452         "movl $1f,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00453         "movl %2,%%ecx\n\t" \
00454         "movl %3,%%edi\n\t" \
00455         "movl (%%ecx),%%esp\n\t" \
00456         "pushl (%%edi)\n\t" \
00457         "testl %%edx,%%edx\n\t" \
00458         "jne  __switch_to\n\t" \
00459         "ret\n\t" \
00460 "1:      popl %%ebp\n\t" \
00461         "popl %%edi\n\t" \
00462         "popl %%ecx\n\t" \
00463       : /* no output */ \
00464       : "m" (out_tcb->espp), \
00465         "m" (out_tcb->eipp), \
00466         "m" (in_tcb->espp), \
00467         "m" (in_tcb->eipp), \
00468         "b" (out_tcb), \
00469         "S" (in_tcb), \
00470         "a" (outproc), \
00471         "d" (inproc));
00472 
00473 #else /* GCC version >= 3.2 */
00474 
00475     long ebx_out, ecx_out, edi_out, esi_out;
00476     
00477     __asm__ __volatile__( \
00478         "pushl %%ebp\n\t" \
00479         "movl %6,%%ecx\n\t" \
00480         "movl %%esp,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00481         "movl %7,%%ecx\n\t" \
00482         "movl $1f,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00483         "movl %8,%%ecx\n\t" \
00484         "movl %9,%%edi\n\t" \
00485         "movl (%%ecx),%%esp\n\t" \
00486         "pushl (%%edi)\n\t" \
00487         "testl %%edx,%%edx\n\t" \
00488         "jne  __switch_to\n\t" \
00489         "ret\n\t" \
00490 "1:      popl %%ebp\n\t" \
00491       : "=b" (ebx_out), \
00492         "=&c" (ecx_out), \
00493         "=S" (esi_out), \
00494         "=D" (edi_out), \
00495         "+a" (outproc), \
00496         "+d" (inproc) \
00497       : "m" (out_tcb->espp), \
00498         "m" (out_tcb->eipp), \
00499         "m" (in_tcb->espp), \
00500         "m" (in_tcb->eipp));
00501 
00502 #endif /* GCC version < 3.2 */
00503 }
00504 
00505 static inline void xnarch_switch_to (xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00506                                      xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb)
00507 {
00508     struct task_struct *outproc = out_tcb->active_task;
00509     struct task_struct *inproc = in_tcb->user_task;
00510 
00511     if (inproc && outproc->thread_info->status & TS_USEDFPU)        
00512         /* __switch_to will try and use __unlazy_fpu, so that the ts
00513            bit need to be cleared. */
00514         clts();
00515     
00516     in_tcb->active_task = inproc ?: outproc;
00517 
00518     if (inproc && inproc != outproc)
00519         {
00520         struct mm_struct *oldmm = outproc->active_mm;
00521 
00522         switch_mm(oldmm,inproc->active_mm,inproc);
00523 
00524         if (!inproc->mm)
00525             enter_lazy_tlb(oldmm,inproc);
00526         }
00527 
00528     __switch_threads(out_tcb,in_tcb,outproc,inproc);
00529 
00530     stts();
00531 }
00532 
00533 static inline void xnarch_finalize_and_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb,
00534                                                xnarchtcb_t *next_tcb) {
00535     xnarch_switch_to(dead_tcb,next_tcb);
00536 }
00537 
00538 static inline void xnarch_finalize_no_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb) {
00539     /* Empty */
00540 }
00541 
00542 static inline void xnarch_init_root_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00543                                          struct xnthread *thread,
00544                                          const char *name)
00545 {
00546     tcb->user_task = current;
00547     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00548     tcb->esp = 0;
00549     tcb->espp = &tcb->esp;
00550     tcb->eipp = &tcb->eip;
00551     tcb->fpup = NULL;
00552 }
00553 
00554 static inline void xnarch_init_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb) {
00555 
00556     tcb->user_task = NULL;
00557     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00558     tcb->espp = &tcb->esp;
00559     tcb->eipp = &tcb->eip;
00560     tcb->fpup = &tcb->fpuenv;
00561     /* Must be followed by xnarch_init_thread(). */
00562 }
00563 
00564 asmlinkage static void xnarch_thread_redirect (struct xnthread *self,
00565                                                int imask,
00566                                                void(*entry)(void *),
00567                                                void *cookie)
00568 {
00569     /* xnpod_welcome_thread() will do clts() if needed. */
00570     stts();
00571     rthal_local_irq_restore(!!imask);
00572     xnpod_welcome_thread(self);
00573     entry(cookie);
00574     xnpod_delete_thread(self);
00575 }
00576 
00577 static inline void xnarch_init_thread (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00578                                        void (*entry)(void *),
00579                                        void *cookie,
00580                                        int imask,
00581                                        struct xnthread *thread,
00582                                        char *name)
00583 {
00584     unsigned long **psp = (unsigned long **)&tcb->esp;
00585 
00586     tcb->eip = (unsigned long)&xnarch_thread_redirect;
00587     tcb->esp = (unsigned long)tcb->stackbase;
00588     **psp = 0;  /* Commit bottom stack memory */
00589     *psp = (unsigned long *)(((unsigned long)*psp + tcb->stacksize - 0x10) & ~0xf);
00590     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)cookie;
00591     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)entry;
00592     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)imask;
00593     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)thread;
00594     *--(*psp) = 0;
00595 }
00596 
00597 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00598 
00599 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00600 
00601 {
00602     /* Initialize the FPU for an emerging kernel-based RT thread. This
00603        must be run on behalf of the emerging thread. */
00604 
00605     __asm__ __volatile__ ("clts; fninit");
00606 
00607     if (cpu_has_xmm)
00608         {
00609         unsigned long __mxcsr = 0x1f80UL & 0xffbfUL;
00610         __asm__ __volatile__ ("ldmxcsr %0": : "m" (__mxcsr));
00611         }
00612 }
00613 
00614 static inline void xnarch_save_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00615 
00616 {
00617     if (!tcb->user_task) /* __switch_to() will take care otherwise. */
00618         {
00619         clts();
00620 
00621         if (cpu_has_fxsr)
00622             __asm__ __volatile__ ("fxsave %0; fnclex" : "=m" (*tcb->fpup));
00623         else
00624             __asm__ __volatile__ ("fnsave %0; fwait" : "=m" (*tcb->fpup));
00625         }
00626 }
00627 
00628 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00629 
00630 {
00631     struct task_struct *task = tcb->user_task;
00632 
00633     if (task)
00634         {
00635         if (!task->used_math)
00636             {
00637             stts();
00638             return;     /* Uninit fpu area -- do not restore. */
00639             }
00640 
00641         /* Tell Linux that this task has altered the state of the FPU
00642            hardware. */
00643         task->thread_info->status |= TS_USEDFPU;
00644         }
00645 
00646     /* Restore the FPU hardware with valid fp registers from a
00647        user-space or kernel thread. */
00648 
00649     clts();
00650 
00651     if (cpu_has_fxsr)
00652         __asm__ __volatile__ ("fxrstor %0": /* no output */ : "m" (*tcb->fpup));
00653     else
00654         __asm__ __volatile__ ("frstor %0": /* no output */ : "m" (*tcb->fpup));
00655 }
00656 
00657 #else /* !CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00658 
00659 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00660 
00661 {}
00662 
00663 static inline void xnarch_save_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00664 
00665 {}
00666 
00667 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00668 
00669 {}
00670 
00671 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00672 
00673 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00674 
00675 static inline int xnarch_send_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t cpumask) {
00676 
00677     return adeos_send_ipi(ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0, cpumask);
00678 }
00679 
00680 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void))
00681 
00682 {
00683     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00684                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00685                                      (void (*)(unsigned)) handler,
00686                                      NULL,
00687                                      IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00688 }
00689 
00690 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void)
00691 
00692 {
00693     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00694                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00695                                      NULL,
00696                                      NULL,
00697                                      IPIPE_PASS_MASK);
00698 }
00699 
00700 static struct semaphore xnarch_finalize_sync;
00701 
00702 static void xnarch_finalize_cpu(unsigned irq)
00703 {
00704     up(&xnarch_finalize_sync);
00705 }
00706 
00707 static inline void xnarch_notify_halt(void)
00708     
00709 {
00710     xnarch_cpumask_t other_cpus = cpu_online_map;
00711     unsigned cpu, nr_cpus = num_online_cpus();
00712     unsigned long flags;
00713     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00714 
00715     init_MUTEX_LOCKED(&xnarch_finalize_sync);
00716 
00717     /* Here adp_current is in fact root, since xnarch_notify_halt is
00718        called from xnpod_shutdown, itself called from Linux
00719        context. */
00720     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(adp_current, ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI2,
00721                               xnarch_finalize_cpu, NULL, IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00722 
00723     adeos_lock_cpu(flags);
00724     cpu_clear(cpuid, other_cpus);
00725     adeos_send_ipi(ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI2, other_cpus);
00726     adeos_unlock_cpu(flags);
00727 
00728     for(cpu=0; cpu < nr_cpus-1; ++cpu)
00729         down(&xnarch_finalize_sync);
00730     
00731     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(adp_current, ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI2, NULL, NULL,
00732                               IPIPE_PASS_MASK);
00733 }
00734 
00735 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00736 
00737 static inline int xnarch_send_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t cpumask) {
00738 
00739     return 0;
00740 }
00741 
00742 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void)) {
00743 
00744     return 0;
00745 }
00746 
00747 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void) {
00748 
00749     return 0;
00750 }
00751 
00752 #define xnarch_notify_halt() /* Nullified */
00753 
00754 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00755 
00756 static inline void xnarch_notify_shutdown(void)
00757 
00758 {
00759 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00760     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00761        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00762     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00763 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00764 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00765     xnshadow_release_events();
00766 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00767     /* Wait for the currently processed events to drain. */
00768     set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00769     schedule_timeout(50);
00770     xnarch_release_ipi();
00771 }
00772 
00773 static inline int xnarch_escalate (void)
00774 
00775 {
00776     extern int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00777 
00778     if (adp_current == adp_root)
00779         {
00780         spl_t s;
00781         splsync(s);
00782         adeos_trigger_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00783         splexit(s);
00784         return 1;
00785         }
00786 
00787     return 0;
00788 }
00789 
00790 static void xnarch_notify_ready (void)
00791 
00792 {
00793 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION    
00794     xnshadow_grab_events();
00795 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00796 }
00797 
00798 #endif /* XENO_POD_MODULE */

00800 #ifdef XENO_SHADOW_MODULE
00801 
00802 static inline void xnarch_init_shadow_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00803                                            struct xnthread *thread,
00804                                            const char *name)
00805 {
00806     struct task_struct *task = current;
00807 
00808     tcb->user_task = task;
00809     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00810     tcb->esp = 0;
00811     tcb->espp = &task->thread.esp;
00812     tcb->eipp = &task->thread.eip;
00813     tcb->fpup = &task->thread.i387;
00814 }
00815 
00816 static inline void xnarch_grab_xirqs (void (*handler)(unsigned irq))
00817 
00818 {
00819     unsigned irq;
00820 
00821     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00822         adeos_virtualize_irq(irq,
00823                              handler,
00824                              NULL,
00825                              IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00826 }
00827 
00828 static inline void xnarch_lock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00829 
00830 {
00831     unsigned irq;
00832 
00833     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00834         {
00835         switch (irq)
00836             {
00837 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00838             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00839             case INVALIDATE_TLB_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00840             case CALL_FUNCTION_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00841             case RESCHEDULE_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00842 
00843                 /* Never lock out these ones. */
00844                 continue;
00845 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00846 
00847             default:
00848 
00849                 __adeos_lock_irq(adp,cpuid,irq);
00850             }
00851         }
00852 }
00853 
00854 static inline void xnarch_unlock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00855 
00856 {
00857     unsigned irq;
00858 
00859     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00860         {
00861         switch (irq)
00862             {
00863 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00864             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00865             case INVALIDATE_TLB_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00866             case CALL_FUNCTION_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00867             case RESCHEDULE_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00868 
00869                 continue;
00870 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00871 
00872             default:
00873 
00874                 __adeos_unlock_irq(adp,irq);
00875             }
00876         }
00877 }
00878 
00879 #endif /* XENO_SHADOW_MODULE */

00881 #ifdef XENO_TIMER_MODULE
00882 
00883 static inline void xnarch_program_timer_shot (unsigned long delay) {
00884     /* Even though some architectures may use a 64 bits delay here, we
00885        voluntarily limit to 32 bits, 4 billions ticks should be enough for
00886        now. If a timer need more, a spurious but harmless call to the tick
00887        handler will occur after 4 billions ticks. */
00888     rthal_set_timer_shot(rthal_imuldiv(delay,RTHAL_TIMER_FREQ,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ));
00889 }
00890 
00891 static inline void xnarch_stop_timer (void) {
00892     rthal_release_timer();
00893 }
00894 
00895 static inline int xnarch_send_timer_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t mask)
00896 
00897 {
00898 #if CONFIG_SMP
00899     return adeos_send_ipi(RTHAL_APIC_TIMER_IPI, mask);
00900 #else /* ! CONFIG_SMP */
00901     return 0;
00902 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00903 }
00904 
00905 static inline void xnarch_read_timings (unsigned long long *shot,
00906                                         unsigned long long *delivery,
00907                                         unsigned long long defval)
00908 {
00909 #ifdef CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING
00910     int cpuid = adeos_processor_id();
00911     *shot = __adeos_profile_data[cpuid].irqs[__adeos_tick_irq].t_handled;
00912     *delivery = __adeos_profile_data[cpuid].irqs[__adeos_tick_irq].t_synced;
00913 #else /* !CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING */
00914     *shot = defval;
00915     *delivery = defval;
00916 #endif /* CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING */
00917 }
00918 
00919 #endif /* XENO_TIMER_MODULE */

00943 #ifdef XENO_MAIN_MODULE
00944 
00945 #include <nucleus/asm/calibration.h>
00946 
00947 extern u_long nkschedlat;
00948 
00949 extern u_long nktimerlat;
00950 
00951 int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00952 
00953 int xnpod_trap_fault(xnarch_fltinfo_t *fltinfo);
00954 
00955 void xnpod_schedule_handler(void);
00956 
00957 static rthal_trap_handler_t xnarch_old_trap_handler;
00958 
00959 static int xnarch_trap_fault (adevinfo_t *evinfo)
00960 {
00961     xnarch_fltinfo_t fltinfo;
00962 
00963     fltinfo.vector = evinfo->event;
00964     fltinfo.errcode = ((struct pt_regs *)evinfo->evdata)->orig_eax;
00965     fltinfo.regs = (struct pt_regs *)evinfo->evdata;
00966 
00967     return xnpod_trap_fault(&fltinfo);
00968 }
00969 
00970 static inline unsigned long xnarch_calibrate_timer (void)
00971 
00972 {
00973 #if CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0
00974     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY);
00975 #else /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY unspecified. */
00976     /* Compute the time needed to program the PIT in aperiodic
00977        mode. The return value is expressed in CPU ticks. Depending on
00978        whether CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC is enabled or not in the kernel
00979        configuration RTAI is compiled against,
00980        CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY will either refer to the local
00981        APIC or 8254 timer latency value. */
00982     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(rthal_calibrate_timer());
00983 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0 */
00984 }
00985 
00986 int xnarch_calibrate_sched (void)
00987 
00988 {
00989     nktimerlat = xnarch_calibrate_timer();
00990 
00991     if (!nktimerlat)
00992         return -ENODEV;
00993 
00994     nkschedlat = xnarch_ns_to_tsc(xnarch_get_sched_latency());
00995 
00996     return 0;
00997 }
00998 
00999 static inline int xnarch_init (void)
01000 
01001 {
01002     int err;
01003 
01004 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
01005     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
01006        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
01007     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
01008 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
01009 
01010     err = xnarch_calibrate_sched();
01011 
01012     if (err)
01013         return err;
01014 
01015     xnarch_escalation_virq = adeos_alloc_irq();
01016 
01017     if (xnarch_escalation_virq == 0)
01018         return -ENOSYS;
01019 
01020     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
01021                               xnarch_escalation_virq,
01022                               (void (*)(unsigned))&xnpod_schedule_handler,
01023                               NULL,
01024                               IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
01025 
01026     xnarch_old_trap_handler = rthal_set_trap_handler(&xnarch_trap_fault);
01027 
01028 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
01029     err = xnshadow_mount();
01030 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
01031 
01032     if (err)
01033         {
01034         rthal_set_trap_handler(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
01035         adeos_free_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
01036         }
01037 
01038     return err;
01039 }
01040 
01041 static inline void xnarch_exit (void)
01042 
01043 {
01044 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
01045     xnshadow_cleanup();
01046 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
01047     rthal_set_trap_handler(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
01048     adeos_free_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
01049 }
01050 
01051 #endif /* XENO_MAIN_MODULE */
01052 
01053 #ifdef XENO_TRACES_MODULE
01054 
01055 #include <asm/timex.h>          /* For cpu_khz */
01056 #include <linux/kernel_stat.h>  /* For kstat_irqs */
01057 
01058 #if CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC
01059 
01060 #define RTAI_TRACE_TIMER_IRQ       RTHAL_APIC_TIMER_IPI
01061 #define linux_timer_irq_count(cpu) (irq_stat[(cpu)].apic_timer_irqs)
01062 
01063 #else /* !CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */
01064 
01065 #define RTAI_TRACE_TIMER_IRQ       RTHAL_8254_IRQ
01066 #define linux_timer_irq_count(cpu) (kstat_cpu(cpu).irqs[RTHAL_8254_IRQ])
01067 
01068 #endif /* CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */
01069 
01070 #define tsc2ms(timestamp)          rthal_ulldiv((timestamp), cpu_khz, NULL)
01071 
01072 #endif /* XENO_TRACES_MODULE */
